p: Lipoproteins with high atherogenic effects, such as TRLs, are closely related to CHD. Therefore, it is considered that the determination of postprandial lipemia is more sensitive and prominent than fasting lipids in the risk assessment of CHD ( 35, 36). The clinical research protocols for postprandial lipemia have not been unified, and the evaluation of related animal models is still being explored, so the management guidelines for postprandial lipemia still need to be improved ( 37).
